page.title: 20PROBLEMS IN PILLEY/BOLDRE
page.content: There are few jobs actually available within the area and the amenities of modern living are few.Both these problems could be negated by the provision of a good bus service,as now the use of a car is almost essential. Thus teenagers feel they are not catered for and are restricted in their choice of recreation .Housing,as in similar villages tends to be expensive.Cheap"starter Homes"are difficult to obtain.Planners put high priority on preserving the essential nature of the area.For instance a proposed oil pipeline tobe laid across the area is causing considerable discussion and some opposition.Most inhabitants,from Elanor aged 10 to the lady in her 80's and all the others who helped Boldre W.I.to compile this report,take pleasure in the mainly rural nature of Boldre
